title: Simple circuits - battery bulb resistors switch

content.prompt: The figure shows a circuit consisting of a battery, a lightbulb, two resistors, and a switch. The switch is initially open. If the switch is then closed, does the current through the lightbulb change? What evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: Yes, the current changes. The switch prevents charge from flowing in the circuit when it is open, but not when it is closed.
Yes, the current changes. Closing the switch creates an additional closed electrical loop and the lightbulb is part of this loop.
No, the current does not change. The lightbulb and the switch are not in series with one another.
No, the current does not change. There is a closed electrical loop in the circuit regardless of whether the switch is open or closed.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
